title: Redesign login screen to match provided screenshot (email/password style UI using Internet Identity)

requirements.text: Update the unauthenticated login UI to visually match the provided screenshot: full-screen dark header/background, large white rounded-corner sheet, "Log in" title, "Don’t have an account? Sign up" row with the "Sign up" styled as a link, two large rounded input fields (email + password), a "Forgot Password?" link, and a wide rounded "Continue" primary CTA at the bottom.

quotes: I want to build my login like that on the screenshot

acceptanceCriteria: When logged out, the app renders a login screen that matches the screenshot’s layout and spacing (dark top/background + white sheet + large rounded inputs + bottom CTA).
The layout is mobile-first and remains usable on desktop (content centered with sensible max width).

All user-facing text on this screen is in English and matches the screenshot wording (including capitalization and punctuation) unless Internet Identity constraints require additional clarifying copy (handled in REQ-2).

requirements.text: Preserve Internet Identity as the only authentication method while presenting the screenshot-style form: the "Continue" button must trigger the existing Internet Identity login flow (useInternetIdentity().login). Email/password fields must not attempt email/password authentication; instead, treat them as non-auth fields (e.g., optional/disabled or ignored) and provide clear inline/helper messaging so users understand Internet Identity is used (without cluttering the UI).

quotes: I want to build my login like that on the screenshot

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "Continue" starts the Internet Identity login flow and shows a loading state consistent with the rest of the app (e.g., spinner + disabled CTA) while loginStatus is "logging-in".
No API calls, backend mutations, or local storage mechanisms are introduced for email/password authentication.
A concise, visible explanation indicates that login is via Internet Identity (and not email/password), without reintroducing the old large alert card UI.

requirements.text: Implement screenshot-like interactions on the login screen: password visibility toggle icon inside the password field, link styling for "Forgot Password?" and "Sign up", and appropriate disabled/pressed states for the "Continue" button.

quotes: I want to build my login like that on the screenshot

acceptanceCriteria: Password field includes a visibility toggle that switches between masked/unmasked states and is keyboard accessible.

"Forgot Password?" and "Sign up" are rendered as links/buttons with hover/focus styles and do not break navigation (they may open an informational modal/toast explaining Internet Identity if no dedicated routes exist).
The primary CTA reflects disabled state while logging in and cannot be double-submitted.

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose existing UI primitives instead).
Do not change authentication away from Internet Identity; do not add email/password authentication.
Keep routing/auth gating behavior in frontend/src/App.tsx intact (still show the login UI when identity is absent).
nonGoals: Building a real email/password authentication system.
Implementing full sign-up and password reset backends/flows.
Changing backend Motoko canister logic for authentication.
